intro: Lasiocroton subpeltatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal or inland desert regions.
